nodes.bodyText:
I wonder if instead of ready we should use the term completed not to conflate with the idea of a CR being ready.
Just in the case of deletes it seems slightly strange to pass a deletion boolean supplier as 'ready' but it really is a case of semantics... just a thought not expecting a change unless you strongly agree.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -52,14 +52,15 @@
     /**
      * @param vertx The vertx instance.
      * @param logContext A string used for context in logging.
+     * @param logState The state we are waiting for use in log messages
      * @param pollIntervalMs The poll interval in milliseconds.
      * @param timeoutMs The timeout, in milliseconds.
      * @param ready Determines when the wait is complete by returning true.

nodes.bodyText: I think that makes very good sense. Thanks for raising it.
